title: Synthetic Recap
body:
BOSTON (AP) – In the hallowed halls of basketball, there are nights that belong not to teams, but to men. Monday night at a rapturous arena belonged to one man: Reggie Lewis. The Boston Celtics’ star didn’t just play a basketball game; he authored a masterpiece, pouring in a career-high and franchise-tying 42 points to single-handedly wrestle a 107-103 victory from the gutsy Toronto Raptors.

From the opening tip, Lewis was in a different stratosphere. The Raptors had no answer for his silky-smooth mid-range jumper and explosive drives to the hoop. He was the offense, a one-man torrent against a Toronto team that fought valiantly but simply could not stem the tide. While the Raptors showcased a balanced effort, with five players scoring between 14 and 19 points, their collective firepower paled in comparison to Lewis’s incandescent solo performance.

The game tightened in the final minutes, the pressure mounting with every possession. But every time Toronto threatened, Lewis had an answer. A pull-up here, a dagger from the baseline there. He was the Celtics’ clutch gene, their security, their everything. His 42 points, a number that places him alongside Celtic legends in the record books, were not just statistics; they were the very foundation of the victory.

On this night, the final score was a mere formality. The real story was the historic, virtuoso performance of Reggie Lewis, who for one unforgettable evening, didn't just wear the green and white—he carried its entire legacy on his back.
